subject: Re: [junit] assertEqual and assertSame
msgSnippet: Here s an example : String a = xyz ; String b = a; String c = xy ; c = c + z ;  // split over two lines to prevent compiler optimization // these will pass
messageBody:
Here's an example :

String a = "xyz";
String b = a;
String c = "xy";
c = c + "z"; // split over two lines to prevent compiler optimization


// these will pass because a.equals(b) and a.equals(c)
assertEquals(a, b);
assertEquals(a, c);

// this will pass because a == b
assertSame(a, b);

// this will fail because a != c
assertSame(a, c);

Kevin

----- Original Message -----
From: "cute4gerbil" <cute4gerbil@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 22, 2004 6:26 PM
Subject: [junit] assertEqual and assertSame


> Hi,
> can anyone tell me what is the different between the use of
> assertEqual and assertSame.
>
> What i know is that assertEqual is "Asserts that two objects are
> equal. If they are not an AssertionFailedError is thrown."
>
> And assertSame is "Asserts that two objects refer to the same object.
> If they are not an AssertionFailedError is thrown."
>
> can u give me a example how they are being used differently.
>
> Thank =)
>
